messageBody:
My introduction to TDD was Martin's Craftsman column which first
appeared in "Embedded Systems." TDD is explained as a series of stories
about a young programmer learning the ropes. These are entertaing,
bite-size packets of instruction useful even to old codgers like me.

The stories are now on-line at:
http://butunclebob.com/ArticleS.UncleBob.CraftsmanColumn

Joel Altman

To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Essay: The Trouble With JUnit

Hey JB,

The primary goal of Agile Java is to give [ new programmers | non-java
programmers | non-TDD practitioners ] a technique for learning how to
construct quality Java systems. I've found TDD to be a good teaching
tool in itself. The book introduces OO design concepts throughout (not
in a heavy-handed fashion, however), my attempt to make a more seamless
learning experience.

<snip>

Jeff

With Test-Driven Development
